runs.comm: full on middle and leg, thuds into the pad as Dilshan tries to flick, runs away towards covers for a leg-bye
slower ball first up to Jayasuriya, 112kmh, on a length just outside off, Jayasuriya defends off the front foot
a touch shorter this time, same tight line, Jayasuriya prods it watchfully towards the covers
sharp bouncer from Taylor, 137kmh, hurries Jayasuriya who goes for the pull, doesn't get hold of it but it flies safely over square leg
slower bouncer from Taylor this time, wide outside off, Dilshan helps it along to third man for a single
overpitched on middle, Jaysuriya punches it towards midwicket, a single to end the over
first boundary of the innings, fullish around off, slapped through cover for four
shorter ball this time, not much room for Jaysuriya to cut, the batsman attempts the shot anyway, but he's beaten
Jayasuriya isn't one to hang around, length ball and a bit of width for Jayasuriya, who thumps it high over point for a boundary
closer to offstump this time, similar length, Jayasuriya chops it firmly to backward point
effortless, poor delivery that, a bit short on the pads,  Jayasuriya rocks back and swings it over the deep backward square leg boundary

Jayasuriya is looking in good touch here, a bit wide from the bowler, and he flashes it past point, there's a sweeper out in the deep who has to race across to cut it off, great running from the Sri Lankans, a rare three
overpitched on the pads, Jayasuriya flicks it in the air over midwicket for a couple
front-foot no ball, free hit time , it was a length ball just outside off, Jaysuriya couldn't do much with that one, lets see how he deals with the next one
well done by the bowler, a slower bouncer that just didn't rise at all, 113kmh, and bowled from behind the crease, went to the keeper on the third bounce
Bang! Taylor ups his pace this time, and Jayasuriya was waiting on the backfoot for that, there's a deep midwicket in place but he can watch as the ball sails over his head

a slower bouncer, 118kmh, 73mph, Jaysuriya went for the pull again, misses and is hit on the midriff, goes for a quick single, the bowler runs scroos and tries to throw down the stumps at the non-striker's end, Jayasuriya was gone if that had hit
back of a length, outside off, slapped towards point by Dilshan
full ball on offstump to end the over, Jayasuriya punches it back towards the bowler, who misfields but mid-off is there to stop the ball
it was a length ball, Dilshan decides to stay in the crease and tries to thrash it past mid-off, mistimed in that direction
full ball just outside off, Jayasuriya plays it with soft hands towards extra cover and they sprint a quick single
attempts the slower ball, 111kmh, but was a loopy full toss well outside off, Dilshan was a bit thrown by the lack of pace, he manages to swipe that towards deep midwicket though
quick delivery, but badly directed, angling way across the batsman, Ramdin does well to collect that one
much better, slower ball on a length, on offstump as well, drawing Jayasuriya forward, the batsman was looking ot tip it and run but hit it too firmly for a single
short and wide, lucky to get away with that Bravo, Jayasuriya was winding up for a big swing, he doesn't connect too well though, and the ball trickles towards short third man
smash! don't gove width to Jayasuriya, bowlers should know that by now, he absolutely hammers this one past the point fielder
tossed up and into the pads, Dilshan plays it inside out towards extra cover
pitching on a length outside off, Jayasuriya gets down on one knee as he sweeps it behind square
Dilshan defends this one off the front foot towards mid-off, no run there
flatter one on the pads, Dilshan punches it to mid-on for an easy single
Benn drags it short on seeing the batsman give the charge, Jayasuriya can only slap it to cover
Jayasuriya's not be denied this time, again bends his knee and sweeps it powerfully, there's a fielder at deep midwicket but the placement and power beats him
Dilshan plays that outrageous ramp shot which took him to his half-century against Australia, does he even watch the ball when he connects, it flies straight over the keeper's head for a boundary
a bouncer from Pollard this time, Dilshan tries the shot again but doesn't connect, hits his body on the way to the keeper, who puts in a muted appeal
boom! no need for the unorthodox when can play those, banged in short, Dilshan cracks it over backward point for a six, just clears the ropes
another short ball, Dilshan backs away to give himself room, and scythes that past point for a boundary
on the pads this time, and fuller in length, Dilshan works it towards midwicket for a single
beautiful from Jayasuriya, overpitched outside off, not too much effort behind that shot but it sails over mid-off and goes for a one-bounce four, that nearly cleared the ropes
fired in full outside off, Dilshan looks to work it towards point but doesn't connect well
a touch shorter, Dilshan does get it away to point this time, batsman jog through for a single
Jayasuriya shows us he can play the reverse-sweep, he doesn't get hold of it too well, gets it fine past short third man
given some air, slightly overpitched but pretty wide, Jayaasuriya plays a superbly timed late cut which has the ball racing away for a boundary
turned towards fine leg for a single, Sri Lanka are cruising here
Dilshan rocks back and dabs it towards short third man, Jayasuriya bellows "Nooooooo" and they decide against the single
length ball on the middle, Jayasuriya taps it towards mid-on and screams "yeah yeah yeah yeah yeah" to signal he wants the single
slower ball on offstump, Dilshan was looking to play it inside out towards the covers, mistimes it back to the bowler
fast and full, but sliding down the leg side, Bravo will have to re-bowl that one
low full toss on offstump, Dilshan punches it towards mid-off for a single, Bravo puts in a dive in his follow through but he can't stop the ball

Jayasuriya reaches his half-century with an unconvincing cut, it was pretty close to the offstump, Jayasuriya went for the cut, top-edges it and it balloons high in the air, but it lands wide of the third man fielder.

 "Celebrate Good times, comes on" booms around the ground
slapped with a horizontal bat towards long-off for a single
full on offstump, Dilshan squeezes it out towards point but again Jayasuriya declines what would have been a tight single
Benn continues to toss the ball up, Jayasuriya plays it watchfully back to the bowler
sweeps it to short fine leg, straight to the fielder
superb timing on the reverse-sweep from Jayasuriya, not often he plays that shot, but he gets hold of the ball this time, sends it sailing over the point fielder
struck firmly back to the bowler
fired into the pads, dug out towards mid-on but no run again
very short from Benn, Jayasuriya doesn't capitalise though, he swings it towards square leg for a single
Jayasuriya is on fire here, again the lofted square drive from him, welcoming Edwards to the crease with a massive six
short and on the leg stump, Jayasuriya looks to pull powerfully, doesn't connect too well, the ball trickles towards the leg side
fired in quick, aiming for the blockhole, Dilshan shuffles across and wrists it away towards mid-on

Jayasuriya survives, that was another bouncer on the legstump from Edwards, top-edge from the batsman, Lendl Simmons throws in a despairing dive to try to catch it but fails, and that's another boundary
Edwards is proving extremely expensive here, Sri Lanka's hundred comes up as Jayasuriya helps another short ball on legstump very fine down the leg side

another boundary to finish the over, where are the yorkers? this was short again, and wide, Jayasuriya shows us he can mix finesse with the fireworks, just glides it past the keeper for four more, he's onto 76
length ball on the offstump, played defensively back to the bowler
this time Dilshan gets a single, punches the ball towards mid-off
Jayasuriya gets his front leg well outside off stump, and sweeps that delicately behind square, Jayasuriya may be ageing but he's still very quick and he gets back for the second
paddle-swept this time by Jayasuriya for a single
on the leg stump, Dilshan gets his front foot out of the way, seemingly to go for the big hit, but he only plays it back towards the bowler
Dilshan gets on the backfoot and slaps it towards cover, gets a single to retain the strike
Dilshan shows us he can the reverse-sweep as well, he swats that one powerfully to the point boundary
attempts the shot again, but with less power in an attempt to get it fine, gets a bit of a top edge and it loops towards Benn at short third man, he can't reach it and Dilshan survive
slower ball from Pollard, on legstump, Jayasuriya doesn't connect, hits his pads on the way to the keeper
Jayasuriya punches it past the bowler towards mid-off, and the batsmen saunter through for a single
West Indies don't need sloppy fielding like this, that was awful from Fletcher, played towards fine leg and should have been a two at most for Sri Lanka, but Fletcher makes a hash of a routine stop
short and outside off, Dilshan goes for his favourite cut, doesn't connect though
full and on the pads, Jayasuriya was looking to deposit that over backward square, doesn't get hold of it and the ball dribbles to the leg side
slow, short and wide, Dilshan backs away and slaps that towards cover for a single

plumb lbw, Jayasuriya was going for the reverse-sweep as the third man was up, he's struck low in front of middle and he was nearly walking as the appeal for lbw went up, Simon Taufel has an easy decision to make
very slow delivery, Sangakkara was early on the shot, the ball is in the air a bit before reaching mid-off
overpitched on offstump, Dilshan punches it inside-out towards extra cover for a single
high full toss, looked high enough to be a no-ball but the umpires are satisfied with it, it was outside off, Sangakkara looked to cut but misses
starts with a low full toss on middle, pretty average fielding from West Indies again, Dilshan swatted that to midwicket should have been cut off, but the fielder makes a mess of it
wide outside off, Dilshan chops it towards backward point, straight to the fielder, but the batsmen take a single
that was very wide outside off, extra run for Sri Lanka

mistimed from Sangakkara, was in the air, Bravo was racing in from long-off but realised he can't make it in time, decided to stop and filed it on the bounce but it lands too close to him and he can only get a hand on it, has to run back to get the ball
Dilshan gets more runs in his favoured third man region, that was pretty wide, glided past the short third man fielder
used his feet and tried to swing it to the leg side, doesn't make contact
Dilshan's superb form continues, he brings up his half-century by flicking a full ball on middle and leg to midwicket
good delivery from Simmons, yorker on legstump, Sangakkara can just about dig it out to long-on

not so good this time, short of a length on middle, at that pace it just sits up, Dilshan gets his front foot out of the way, shifts his weight back and swats it past midwicket, that makes him the tournament's leading scorer
this time he thumps it down to long-on for a single, how much do you think Sri Lanka will end up with? 200 possible?
Sangakkara is gone, finds the man at long-on, that was a length ball, he swings it but doesn't get the power or timing he needs, and can't clear the man in the deep
slower ball on a length, sensibly played down to long-off by Jayawardene to get off the mark
yorker on offstump, squeezed out towards point by Jayawardene for a single
West Indies fielding is sloppy again, Dilshan absolutely cracked that one towards extra cover, but the man at the boundary should have stopped that, Simmons is the culprit this time
awesome placement from Dilshan, a bit of width and that was short as well, Dilshan gets it behind the man at point, and the timing sends the ball racing to the boundary
good yorker this time, on middle stump, Dilshan walks across the stumps and plays it towards mid-on, tight single is taken, an overthrown is given away at the keeper's end
overpitched outside off, Dilshan gets under that one and plays it in the air towards long-off, lands safely and that's a single
short ball to end the over, Jayawardene gets inside the line of the ball and delicately dabs it towards third man
short and wide ball, Dilshan was looking to cut that but he doesn't connect with the ball
low full toss on the pads, Dilshan was trying to flick that past fine leg, but he is rapped on the pads, and the ball dribbles towards fine leg for a leg-bye
Jayawardene was waltzing down the track to smash it to midwicket, Bravo digs it in short and the batsman can't do much with that, it goes through to the keeper
yorker on legstump, hits Jayawardene flush on the toe, was hit just outside leg so the umpire turns down Bravo's huge appeal for lbw
this was short, on middle and leg, Dilshan loves the pull shot, which sends this one flying to the fine leg boundary, a bit of a top edge on that one
hit firmly towards mid-off by Dilshan, too firmly to have time for a single
looks to guide it to third man, doesn't make contact
that's the end of Jayawardene, he was looking to pummel that over long-on, gets a top edge and the Ramdin runs across to his left to pouch the skier
Dilshan seems to pull this ramp shot off every time he tries, superb stuff from him, another boundary, straight over the keeper's head

Dilshan's holed out this time, he was gearing up for the reverse- sweep even before the bowler delivered, the ball's on middle and leg, Dilshan plays the reverse, only to find Benn at point, that ends a superb innings from Dilshan
could have had another as Silva was too early into his shot, the ball is in the air for a bit but lands safely before reaching mid-off
fullish on offstump, carved past point by Mubarak for a couple to end the over
pummelled down the ground with a flat bat by Silva, it was a shortish ball, Silva smashes it to long-on from outside off stump
this was much fuller, Silva shuffles across and hammers the ball from offstump to long-on
attempts a slower ball, that slides down the leg side, a free run for Sri Lanka
lovely yorker that, Mubarak was fooled by that, just about gets his bat down in time, squeezed towards point
length ball which was going outside off with the angle, Silva wanted to get that to midwicket but is hit on the pads
that's a boundary, Mubarak takes a couple of paces down the track and swats that attempted slower ball towards midwicket
ends with a great yorker just outside off, Mubarak tried to guide that one down to third man but can't get bat on ball
slow full toss on middle stump, Silva can only work it towards midwicket for a single
bouncer this time, not particularly quick, it was pretty wide outside off, Mubarak tries to cut but gets a thick bottom edge
a wild swing from Silva, that was on a length just missing offstimp, Silva was eying the midwicket boundary, doesn't connect with the ball, this has been a great over so far
and it becomes an even better over, Silva is gone, it was a slower ball outside off, Silva went for the cut, gets a fine edge, Ramdin has to dive forward to complete the catch
another slow bouncer 123kmh, 76mph, Mathews picks that one late, he pulls it towards backward square leg
super over to finish from West Indies, that was on middle stump, the batsman walks across the stumps and flicks it down to fine leg
